Juventus: Real Madrid's Marcelo linked with move to join Cristiano


Gazzetta dello Sport has claimed that Marcelo could follow Cristiano Ronaldo to Juventus, although the Italians have denied the report.

Marcelo has been linked with a summer move to Juventus, just a day after former Real Madrid team-mate Cristiano swapped the Spanish capital for Turin in a sensational 105-million-euro switch.

Juventus deny interest in Real Madrid left-back

However, Bianconeri sources have insisted to this newspaper that they are not targeting the Brazilian international full-back.

Gazzetta claims faltering Sandro talks could see Juve turn to Marcelo

Italian daily Gazzetta dello Sport today claimed that, with talks over a new contract for regular left-back Alex Sandro at an impasse, the Serie A champions could look to Marcelo as an alternative.

Yet to publicly bid Cristiano farewell...

The report also notes that Marcelo has started following Juve on Instagram, and suggests that his failure to say goodbye to Cristiano on social media could be because their paths are about to cross once more.

Real Madrid announce Julen Lopetegui's coaching staff


Julen Lopetegui's coaching staff has been announced by Real Madrid, with the Basque counting on six assistants.

Three of them have moved with Loptegui from the Spain team, his right-hand man Pablo Sanz and fitness assistants Oscar Caro and Jose Conde.

Zinedine Zidane's fitness guru Antonio Pintus is also on the new coaching staff, having decided to stay on at the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu.

The final two spots are taken up by Javier Mayoral, another fitness and conditioning coach, and by Juan Canales, the new goalkeeping coach.

Casillas writes an emotional message for Ronaldo: Farewells hurt


"Farewells hurt and even more when they're for a player like you," the goalkeeper wrote on Twitter.

"I want to thank you for what you have done for the club, which you made even greater than it already was.

"Congratulations for succeeding in your quest to become the best.

"I wish you lots of luck on your new journey."

replies.msg:
The Cristiano effect as Real Madrid lose 1M Twitter followers in 24 hours


The social media impact Cristiano Ronaldo's departure from Real Madrid for a move to Serie A is dramatic with the Spanish Twitter account of the club losing almost one million followers in the time after the announcement of his move to Turin. The official account went from having 31.97 million followers to now less than 31.02 at the time of writing (Thursday July 12).

The social media giant Twitter are also in the course of deleting fake accounts but in this situation that doesn't seem to be the reasoning behind the dramatic loss in followers relating to the Real Madrid account. Despite the recent exodus experienced on their Twitter account, 'Los Blancos' still lead the way in dominating the platform with over 30 million followers, some distance ahead of FC Barcelona with 13.8 million followers and streets ahead of city rivals Atlético who have more than four million followers. (All figures cited reflect the Spanish language Twitter accounts).

Juve upturn

The move of the Madeira born striker has had the opposite effect on the Juventus Twitter account with more than 1.1 new followers following "The Old Lady" on the social media platform which constitutes a growth of almost 20%.

Cristiano Ronaldo himself still dominates the world of football social media with his personal account having a staggering 74 million followers with Neymar in second place on 40 million. Argentine star Lionel Messi has no official Twitter account but is the most popular player in China with his domination of the Sina and Tencent Weibo platforms.

Gareth Bale set for talks with Real Madrid over future

Gareth Bale's future at Real Madrid will become clearer next week as he holds his first face-to-face talks with new coach Julen Lopetegui, according to Sky sources.

The majority of Real's players will return to training next week with Bale keen to know what role he will have in Lopetegui's plans as he prepares for his first La Liga campaign at the Bernabeu.

Sky Sports News understands that Bale's representatives are also due to travel to Madrid in the next fortnight for talks with club president Florentino Perez to discuss the Wales international's future in the Spanish capital.

Madrid have been linked with summer moves for Neymar, Kylian Mbappe and Eden Hazard. However, they may be unwilling to lose Bale following the departure of Cristiano Ronaldo to Juventus.

The news comes amid renewed reports on Thursday that Manchester United are keen to bring Bale back to the Premier League. However, Sky Sports News understands that no official negotiations have taken place as of yet.

http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11835/11434568/gareth-bale-set-for-talks-with-real-madrid-over-future

HAZARD OVER NEYMAR?

Real Madrid fans would rather their club signed Eden Hazard than Neymar as they look to replace Cristiano Ronaldo, according to a poll in Spanish publication Marca.

200,000 fans were polled with Hazard taking 15 per cent of the vote, ahead of Neymar who claimed 14 per cent. However, the overwhelming first choice for Real Madrid was France and Paris Saint-Germain star Kylian Mbappe who took 54 per cent of the vote.

England skipper Harry Kane earned 10 per cent of the vote.

Happy 18th: Vinicius Junior becomes a Real Madrid player


The Brazilian turns 18 on Thursday and became a Real Madrid player as the club didn't want to break any rules or cause any confusion with FIFA.

Vinicius is already a Real Madrid player. The announcement was made by both sides on May 23, 2017 but the deal officially comes into affect on July 12th 2018 when he turns 18 and can officially become a Real Madrid player.

After the sanction from FIFA for signing minors, Real Madrid were keen to ensure the Brazilian youngster's signing did not break any rules. He was 16 when the transfer to Real Madrid was announced but he was not officially declared a Real Madrid player until Thursday in order to avoid any misunderstandings with FIFA.

Lopetegui wants 120-million-euro valued Rodrigo for Real Madrid

According to El Larguero, the new boss at the Santiago Bernabéu is pushing to bring the Valencia striker he called up for Spain to add to the attacking options for Los Blancos.

https://en.as.com/en/2018/07/13/football/1531468745_095036.html
Julen Lopetegui wants to sign Rodrigo Moreno (currently Valencia). Possible departure of Benzema is the reason. Signing of Rodrigo has no connection with 'galactico' signing. [SER]

AS: Neymar signed a five-year contract worth €37m net a year at PSG. Now they are in talks with his agent & willing to offer him a salary in the region of Messi’s, the world’s highest paid player, at €50m net yearly to keep Real Madrid away.

Real Madrid to unveil Vinicius on Thursday 19 July at 13:00 CEST


The young Brazilian forward is due to arrive in Madrid in the next few hours. He will begin training with the squad on Monday and is expceted to go on the US tour.

Vinicius Junior will be formally unveiled as a new Real Madrid player on Thursday 19 July at 13:00 hours CEST at the Santiago Bernabéu. Vinicius, who is en route from Rio de Janeiro and due to arrive in the Spanish capital in the next few hours, will join his new team mates for his first training session on Monday. It will also be his first encounter with coach Julen Lopetegui and his future team mates.

Vinicius to go on Madrid's US tour

Three days later, Vinicius will be officially unveiled and the day's agenda will be as follows: immediately after the morning session in Valdebebas, he will be chauffered to the Santiago Bernabéu. In the boardroom, he and president Florentino Pérez will sign his contract and perform the usual photocall infront of the Champions League trophies posing with his new Real Madrid shirt. From there, he will go down to the dressing room to change into his new kit and take to the Bernabéu pitch for another photocall. That will be followed by a press conference in the Bernabéu press room. The club have in mind that Vinicius will complete the pre-seaon with the first team squad - including the scheduled tour of the United States.

"If Real Madrid want to sign Mbappé, they'd better be quick"

Christian Karembeu, a former World Cup winner with France also hailed Antoine Griezmann: "He could win the Ballon d'Or, but he'd have to win the World Cup".

Christian Karembeu, former Real Madrid player and a World Cup winner with France 20 years ago, looked ahead to Sunday's final between Les Bleus and Croatia. "It's going to be very difficult, there's no question about that - all finals are. It's a one-off chance to become world champions and it's going to be a tough battle - we're going to have to fight hard for it. I was lucky enough to be a world champions and two decades on, this new generation find themselves facing the same possibility. Let's hope they can do it".

Bale: I was frustrated at not starting the Champions League final


At the Eleven Bar & Grill in Cardiff, Gareth Bale let his true feelings be known regarding the Champions League final against Liverpool.

"I was frustrated, I've said it before, for not being a starter," he said.

"I knew I was capable of being important in the game but that's how it was."

The final will forever be remembered for Bale's astonishing overhead kick.

"It was great to score that goal, pure emotion, it's one of those things you do not think about, you just react," he continued.

"I always wanted to score an overhead kick, but to score it on that occasion... it was definitely the place to do it.

"I went on vacation afterwards and tried to disconnect, so I have not seen it many times... but if you don't try those things, they never come off."
